member.name: T:ZedGraph.Web.GenericViewStateAssistant
member.summary: Assists in managing viewstate sub-objects. The host of the assistant is responsible for managing an array within the statebag. This assistant helps deal with that by simply registering each hosted object with a unique code value. It also simplies the on demand creation of the sub object by creating the instance only when the getobject method is called.
member.author: Darren Martz

member.name: F:ZedGraph.Web.GenericViewStateAssistant.list
member.summary: Array of child class instances managed in the viewstate

member.summary: Default constructor

member.summary: Registers a code with a datatype in the assistance. Once registered the datatype will be available for retrievable using the same code value.

member.summary: Retrieves instance based on the registered code and datatype. If the value is null, the datatype is used to create a new instance that is cached in the assistant node.
member.param: Indicates if the parent is currently tracking viewstate

Indicates if the parent is currently tracking viewstate changes
member.returns: Object instance based on the node found in the collection

member.remarks: Gets or sets a property that determines if this will be drawn smooth. The "smoothness" is controlled by the property.

member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: The pen width used to draw the , in points (1/72 inch)

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebLineItem.SmoothTension
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: Gets or sets a property that determines the smoothing tension for this . This property is only used if is true. A tension value 0.0 will just draw ordinary line segments like an unsmoothed line. A tension value of 1.0 will be smooth. Values greater than 1.0 will generally give odd results.
member.value: A floating point value indicating the level of smoothing. 0.0F for no smoothing, 1.0F for lots of smoothing, >1.0 for odd smoothing.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebLineItem.LineStyle
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: The style of the , defined as a enum. This allows the line to be solid, dashed, or dotted.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebLineItem.StepType
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: Determines if the will be drawn by directly connecting the points from the data collection, or if the curve will be a "stair-step" in which the points are connected by a series of horizontal and vertical lines that represent discrete, constant values. Note that the values can be forward oriented ForwardStep () or rearward oriented RearwardStep. That is, the points are defined at the beginning or end of the constant value for which they apply, respectively. The property is ignored for lines that have set to true.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebAxis.Cross
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: This property allows the axis to be shifted away from its default location. For example, for a graph with an X range from -100 to +100, the Y Axis can be located at the X=0 value rather than the left edge of the ChartRect. This value can be set automatically based on the state of . If this value is set manually, then will also be set to false. The "other" axis is the axis the handles the second dimension for the graph. For the XAxis, the "other" axis is the YAxis. For the YAxis or Y2Axis, the "other" axis is the XAxis.
member.value: The value is defined in user scale units

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebAxis.CrossAuto
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: Determines whether or not the axis intersection point is set automatically.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebAxis.AxisColor
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: This affects only the grid lines, since the and both have their own color specification.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebAxis.Title
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: The title normally shows the basis and dimensions of the scale range, such as "Time (Years)". The title is only shown if the property is set to true. If the Title text is empty, then no title is shown, and no space is "reserved" for the title on the graph.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebAxis.MinSpace
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: This is the minimum axis space allocation. This term, expressed in points (1/72 inch) and scaled according to for the , determines the minimum amount of space an axis must have between the and the . This minimum space applies whether is true or false.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebAxis.IsTicsBetweenLabels
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: This property determines whether or not the major tics will be drawn inbetween the labels, rather than right at the labels. Note that this setting is only applicable if = .

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebAxis.IsZeroLine
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: This boolean value determines if a line will be drawn at the zero value for the axis.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebAxis.IsVisible
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: Determines whether or not the is shown.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebAxis.Type
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: Determines the for this . The type can be either , , , or .

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebAxis.IsOmitMag
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: This property controls whether or not the magnitude factor (power of 10) for this scale will be included in the label. For large scale values, a "magnitude" value (power of 10) is automatically used for scaling the graph. This magnitude value is automatically appended to the end of the Axis (e.g., "(10^4)") to indicate that a magnitude is in use. This property controls whether or not the magnitude is included in the title. Note that it only affects the axis title; a magnitude value may still be used even if it is not shown in the title.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebAxis.IsShowTitle
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: Determines whether or not the will be displayed.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebAxis.IsUseTenPower
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: Determines if powers-of-ten notation will be used for the numeric value labels.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebAxis.IsPreventLabelOverlap
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: This value determines if ZedGraph will check to see if the scale labels are close enough to overlap. If so, ZedGraph will adjust the step size to prevent overlap.

member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: Determines whether or not the maximum scale value is set automatically.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebScale.MinGrace
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: This is the "grace" value applied to the minimum data range. This value is expressed as a fraction of the total data range. For example, assume the data range is from 4.0 to 16.0, leaving a range of 12.0. If MinGrace is set to 0.1, then 10% of the range, or 1.2 will be subtracted from the minimum data value. The scale will then be ranged to cover at least 2.8 to 16.0.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebScale.MaxGrace
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: This is the "grace" value applied to the maximum data range. This value is expressed as a fraction of the total data range. For example, assume the data range is from 4.0 to 16.0, leaving a range of 12.0. If MaxGrace is set to 0.1, then 10% of the range, or 1.2 will be added to the maximum data value. The scale will then be ranged to cover at least 4.0 to 17.2.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebScale.IsReverse
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: Determines if the scale values are reversed for this .

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebScale.FormatAuto
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: Determines whether or not the scale label format is determined automatically based on the range of data values.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebScale.Format
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: The format of the tic labels. This property is only used if the is set to . This property may be set automatically by ZedGraph, depending on the state of .

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebScale.Align
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: Controls the alignment of the tic labels.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebScale.Mag
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: The magnitude multiplier for scale values. This is used to limit the size of the displayed value labels. For example, if the value is really 2000000, then the graph will display 2000 with a 10^3 magnitude multiplier. This value can be determined automatically depending on the state of . If this value is set manually by the user, then will also be set to false.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.Web.ZedGraphWebScale.MagAuto
member.summary: Proxy property that gets or sets the value of .
member.remarks: Determines whether the value will be set automatically based on the data, or manually by the user. If the user manually sets the value, then this flag will be set to false.
